Stem: Thick, green, considered a 'pseudo-stem' as it is composed of tightly packed sheaths. A stem develops within this pseudo-stem.
Leaves: Very large and broad blades. Easily torn by the wind, giving frond-like appearance. Grow out of sheaths on stem.
Flowers: which grows out of the stem within the pseudo-stem.
FruitSeeds: Very similar to commercial bananas, but with many seeds within.
Habitat: Forests, paddocks, old gardens, riparian areas.
DistinguishingFeatures: **Note** there are two native species of Banana,  *Musa banksii* and *Musa jackeyi* native to Queensland.
